1.text: Cover your counter with plastic wrap.

2.text: Shield your hands from the jackfruit’s sap with latex gloves.

3.text: Coat the surface of a large, sharp knife in grapeseed oil.

4.text: Cut a 1 1⁄2–2 in (3.8–5.1 cm) wide segment off the end of the jackfruit.

5.text: Continue cutting your jackfruit into 1 1⁄2–2 in (3.8–5.1 cm) wide rounds.

6.text: Cut the white core out of each jackfruit round.

7.text: Separate the yellow pods from the white pulp.

8.text: Open the yellow pods with your fingers to remove the seeds.
